alert.note: Alert for Monroe (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 17 at 6:16AM CDT until June 17 at 6:45AM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 AM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN MONROE...RANDOLPH...SOUTHEASTERN ST. CLAIR... SOUTHEASTERN JEFFERSON...STE. GENEVIEVE AND ST. FRANCOIS COUNTIES... At 616 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Coulterville to near Ste. Genevieve to near Bonne Terre, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Farmington, Chester, Bonne Terre, Desloge, Ste. Genevieve, Sparta, Red Bud, Bismarck, Leadwood, Bremen, Park Hills, Steeleville, Marissa, Percy, Coulterville, Tilden, Iron Mountain Lake, Evansville, Bloomsdale and Baldwin. This also includes St. Joe State Park, St. Francois State Park, Hawn State Park, Felix Valle House State Park, and Missouri Mines Historic Site. This includes Interstate 55 in Missouri between exits 141 and 162. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. To report severe weather contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in St Louis.
